intro: Jatropha phyllacantha var. lobata, commonly known as the lobed spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It is characterized by its alternate, lobed leaves that are often hairy and have a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in dry, arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. The species is part of the Euphorbiaceae family, known for its diverse and often toxic members.
